intro: Centaurea glaberrima subsp. glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces bright blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to gardens and ecological restoration projects.
